title.value: Mitigating Biases with Diverse Ensembles and Diffusion Models
title.justification: This is the title of the paper.
title.quote: Mitigating Biases with Diverse Ensembles and Diffusion Models

extractions.description: This paper proposes an ensemble diversification framework that leverages Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DPMs) to mitigate shortcut learning and bias in deep neural networks. By generating synthetic counterfactuals that break spurious correlations present in the training data, the authors aim to enhance model diversity via ensemble disagreement. The study demonstrates improved generalization and diversification performance on datasets, achieving state-of-the-art results in bias mitigation without the need for additional supervised signals.

type.justification: The study conducts extensive experiments and provides empirical evidence to support its conclusions on model diversification and bias mitigation using Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DPMs).
type.quote: We show that counterfactuals from appropriately trained DPMs can be used to achieve state-of-the-art diversification and shortcut bias mitigation.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on mitigating biases due to shortcut learning in machine learning models by using diverse ensembles and Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DPMs).
name.quote: The primary objective of this work is to mitigate shortcut learning tendencies, particularly when they result in strong, unwarranted biases...

name.justification: The paper explores the use of ensemble methods for model diversification to address shortcut learning and biases.
name.quote: To achieve this objective, we propose an ensemble framework relying on unlabelled ood data for diversification.

name.justification: The study utilizes Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DPMs) as generative tools to create synthetic counterfactuals that aid in mitigating biases.
name.quote: We leverage Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DPMs) to generate synthetic data for ensemble disagreement.

name.justification: The main model used in the study for generating synthetic data to mitigate biases is the Diffusion Probabilistic Model.
name.quote: We leverage Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DPMs) to generate synthetic data for ensemble disagreement.

is_contributed.justification: The paper leverages existing Diffusion Probabilistic Models for the study and does not claim to contribute a new model.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the use of DPMs against other diversification methods involving out-of-distribution data.
is_compared.quote: Our experiments confirm that the extent and quality of our diffusion-guided ensemble diversification is on par with existing methods that rely on additional data.
